DOCU_Docu.DOC:
= Action name = PCK.AUTOMIC_CA_HARVEST.PUB.ACTION.CHECKIN_BY_AGENT
= General description = This action will Check-in file(s) to Harvest repository using a specified file agent
= Failure Conditions = * If another package has reserved version for the file present in Check-in Directory Path, the action will fail. * If Check-in Directory Path contains some files that are not checked out, the action will fail.
= Inputs = - Harvest Agent Name*: Provide the name of the remote Harvest agent from where files will be checked in. E.g. 10.243.44.13 - Agent Port*: Provide port of the remote Harvest agent. E.g. 5521 - Harvest Agent Username*: Provide username to authenticate on remote Harvest agent. E.g. automic - Harvest Agent Password*: Provide the password to authenticate on remote Harvest agent. - Project Name*: Provide name of the working project of the CA Harvest. E.g. DEMO1 - State Name*: Specify current State to which the package belongs to. E.g. Development - Process Name: Provide name of the process to be used. If empty, system picks a default process defined in the system.. E.g. Check Out for Browse - Package Name*: Provide a name of the package for check in. E.g. package_demo - Check-in Directory Path*: Provide full client file system directory path to be used for check-in. E.g. DEMO_1\DOCS - View Path*: Provide view path that corresponds to the current working directory. E.g. C:\hrv - List Of Files or Folders to Check-in: Provide comma-separated files or folder names to be checked-in from check-in directory path. E.g. file1 , file2 - Check-in Description: Provide description to this check-in. E.g. Sample Description - Recursive: Specify whether if system should recursively find files in sub-directories of check-in directory path. Default: No - Delete After Check-in: Specify whether files should be deleted from the client directory after they have been successfully checked in. Default: No - Check-in Mode: Specify check-in mode to be used during this check-in process. Default: Update And Release Check-in Process Mode options: - Update and Release: Specifies that the item in the view is no longer reserved by the specified package after it is updated or created. This package cannot make any more changes until the item is checked out again. - Update and Keep: Specifies that the item in the view is updated or created and the current package keeps it reserved so that more changes can be made. - Release Only: Specifies that no check-in is performed. The item is not updated, but the item is no longer marked as reserved for the current package
- Item Path Options: Specify options to be used for check-in item paths Default: All Files to Same View Path Check-in item paths options: - Preserve and Create: Checks out selected files to paths with names that correspond to their client directory location, and creates any view paths that do not currently exist. - All Item to same Directory: Checks out all selected files to the same path in the destination view, ignoring the client directory structure. - Preserve: Checks out all selected items into corresponding client directories, if they already exist.
- Check-in Item Filter Option: Provide patterns to be used for filtering check-in files. Default: New or Existing Items. Check-in Item Filter Options: - New Items Only: This option limits the check-in to files that do not have corresponding items in the current view. If the item has been removed from the current view, then the file can be checked by using this filter. - Existing Items Only: This option limits the check-in to files that have corresponding items reserved by the package. Any files without corresponding items are skipped. - New Or Existing Items: When this option is selected, all selected files are checked in if they are reserved by the package or did not previously exist in the repository
= Behavior = (none)
=Return Value= UC4RB_HRV_CHECKIN_STATUS#: Status of check-in execution
= Outputs = * Return code is 0 in case of success. * Return code is non-zero in case of failure.
= Rollback = (none)
= Logging = AE logs will be displayed in the AE report.
